Name: allow_url_fopen
Description: This option enables the URL-aware fopen wrappers that enable accessing URL object like files. Default wrappers are provided for the access of remote files using the ftp or http protocol, some extensions like zlib may register additional wrappers.

Name: allow_url_include
Description: This option allows the use of URL-aware fopen wrappers with the following functions: include, include_once, require, require_once.

Name: arg_separator.input
Description: List of separator(s) used by PHP to parse input URLs into variables.

Name: arg_separator.output
Description: The separator used in PHP generated URLs to separate arguments.

Name: assert.active
Changelog: Warning: This feature has been DEPRECATED as of PHP 8.3.0. Relying on this feature is highly discouraged.
Description: Enable assert() evaluation. zend.assertions should be used instead to control the behaviour of assert().

Name: assert.bail
Changelog: Warning: This feature has been DEPRECATED as of PHP 8.3.0. Relying on this feature is highly discouraged.
Description: Terminate script execution on failed assertions.

Name: assert.callback
Changelog: Warning: This feature has been DEPRECATED as of PHP 8.3.0. Relying on this feature is highly discouraged.
Description: User function to call on failed assertions.

Name: assert.exception
Changelog: Warning: This feature has been DEPRECATED as of PHP 8.3.0. Relying on this feature is highly discouraged.
Description: Issue an AssertionError exception for the failed assertion.

Name: assert.quiet_eval
Description: Use the current setting of error_reporting() during assertion expression evaluation. If enabled, no errors are shown (implicit error_reporting(0)) while evaluation. If disabled, errors are shown according to the settings of error_reporting()

Name: assert.warning
Changelog: Warning: This feature has been DEPRECATED as of PHP 8.3.0. Relying on this feature is highly discouraged.
Description: Issue a PHP warning for each failed assertion.

Name: auto_append_file
Description: Specifies the name of a file that is automatically parsed after the main file. The file is included as if it was called with the require function, so include_path is used.

Name: auto_detect_line_endings
Description: When turned on, PHP will examine the data read by fgets() and file() to see if it is using Unix, MS-Dos or Macintosh line-ending conventions.\n\nThis enables PHP to interoperate with Macintosh systems, but defaults to Off, as there is a very small performance penalty when detecting the EOL conventions for the first line, and also because people using carriage-returns as item separators under Unix systems would experience non-backwards-compatible behaviour.

Name: auto_globals_jit
Description:
When enabled, the SERVER, REQUEST, and ENV variables are created when they're first used (Just In Time) instead of when the script starts. If these variables are not used within a script, having this directive on will result in a performance gain.

Warning
Usage of SERVER, REQUEST, and ENV variables is checked during the compile time so using them through e.g. variable variables will not cause their initialization.

Name: auto_prepend_file
Description: Specifies the name of a file that is automatically parsed before the main file. The file is included as if it was called with the require function, so include_path is used.\n\nThe special value none disables auto-prepending.

Name: auto_prepend_file
Description: Specifies the name of a file that is automatically parsed before the main file. The file is included as if it was called with the require function, so include_path is used.

Name: bcmath.scale
Description: Number of decimal digits for all bcmath functions. See also bcscale().

Name: browscap
Description: Name (e.g.: browscap.ini) and location of browser capabilities file. See also get_browser().

Name: cgi.check_shebang_line
Description: Controls whether CGI PHP checks for line starting with #! (shebang) at the top of the running script. This line might be needed if the script support running both as stand-alone script and via PHP CGI. PHP in CGI mode skips this line and ignores its content if this directive is turned on.

Name: cgi.discard_path
Description: If this is enabled, the PHP CGI binary can safely be placed outside of the web tree and people will not be able to circumvent .htaccess security.

Name: cgi.fix_pathinfo
Description: Provides real PATH_INFO/ PATH_TRANSLATED support for CGI. PHP's previous behaviour was to set PATH_TRANSLATED to SCRIPT_FILENAME, and to not grok what PATH_INFO is. For more information on PATH_INFO, see the CGI specs. Setting this to 1 will cause PHP CGI to fix its paths to conform to the spec. A setting of zero causes PHP to behave as before. It is turned on by default. You should fix your scripts to use SCRIPT_FILENAME rather than PATH_TRANSLATED.

Name: cgi.force_redirect
Description: cgi.force_redirect is necessary to provide security running PHP as a CGI under most web servers. Left undefined, PHP turns this on by default. You can turn it off at your own risk.

Name: cgi.nph
Description: If cgi.nph is enabled it will force cgi to always sent Status: 200 with every request.

Name: cgi.redirect_status_env
Description: If cgi.force_redirect is turned on, and you are not running under Apache or Netscape (iPlanet) web servers, you may need to set an environment variable name that PHP will look for to know it is OK to continue execution.

Name: cgi.rfc2616_headers
Description: If enabled, PHP will send the HTTP headers according to RFC2616. This means that the header 'Content-Type' will be sent before any other header. This is a requirement of the RFC.

Name: child_terminate
Description: Specify whether PHP scripts may request child process termination on end of request, see also apache_child_terminate().

Name: cli.pager
Description: External tool to display output from command line.

Name: cli.prompt
Description: Command line prompt.

Name: cli_server.color
Description: Enable the built-in development web server to use ANSI color coding in terminal output.

Name: com.allow_dcom
Description: When this is turned on, PHP will be allowed to operate as a D-COM (Distributed COM) client and will allow the PHP script to instantiate COM objects on a remote server.

Name: com.autoregister_typelib
Description: When this is turned on, PHP will attempt to register constants from the typelibrary of COM objects that it instantiates, if those objects implement the interfaces required to obtain that information. The case sensitivity of the constants it registers is controlled by the com.autoregister_casesensitive php.ini directive.

Name: com.autoregister_verbose
Description: When this is turned on, any problems with loading a typelibrary during object instantiation will be reported using the PHP error mechanism. The default is off, which does not emit any indication if there was an error finding or loading the type library.

Name: com.autoregister_casesensitive
Description: When this is turned on (the default), constants found in auto-loaded type libraries when instatiating COM objects will be registered case sensitively. See com_load_typelib() for more details.

Name: com.code_page
Description: It controls the default character set code-page to use when passing strings to and from COM objects. If set to an empty string, PHP will assume that you want CP_ACP, which is the default system ANSI code page.\r\rIf the text in your scripts is encoded using a different encoding/character set by default, setting this directive will save you from having to pass the code page as a parameter to the com class constructor. Please note that by using this directive (as with any PHP configuration directive), your PHP script becomes less portable; you should use the COM constructor parameter whenever possible.

Name: com.dotnet_version
Description: The version of the .NET framework to use for dotnet objects. The value of the setting is the first three parts of the framework's version number, separated by dots, and prefixed with v, e.g. v4.0.30319.

Name: com.typelib_file
Description: When set, this should hold the path to a file that contains a list of typelibraries that should be loaded on startup. Each line of the file will be treated as the type library name and loaded as though you had called com_load_typelib(). The constants will be registered persistently, so that the library only needs to be loaded once. If a type library name ends with the string #cis or #case_insensitive, then the constants from that library will be registered case insensitively.

Name: curl.cainfo
Description: A default value for the CURLOPT_CAINFO option. This is required to be an absolute path.

Name: date.default_latitude
Description: The default latitude ranging from 0 at the equator, to +90 northward, and -90 southward.

Name: date.default_longitude
Description: The default longitude ranging from 0 at the prime meridian, to +180 eastward, and -180 westward.

Name: date.sunrise_zenith
Changelog: Prior to PHP 8.0.0, the default was '90.583333'
Description: The default sunrise zenith.\r\rThe default value is 90Â°50'. The additional 50' is due to two components: the Sun's radius, which is 16', and the atmospheric refraction, which is 34'.

Name: date.sunset_zenith
Changelog: Prior to PHP 8.0.0, the default was '90.583333'
Description: The default sunset zenith.

Name: date.timezone
Changelog: From PHP 8.2, a warning is emitted when setting this to an invalid value or an empty string.
Description: The default timezone used by all date/time functions. The precedence order for which timezone is used if none is explicitly mentioned is described in the date_default_timezone_get() page. See List of Supported Timezones for a list of supported timezones.

Name: dba.default_handler
Description: The name of the default handler

Name: default_charset
Description: 'UTF-8' is the default value and its value is used as the default character encoding for htmlentities(), html_entity_decode() and htmlspecialchars() if the encoding parameter is omitted. The value of default_charset will also be used to set the default character set for iconv functions if the iconv.input_encoding, iconv.output_encoding and iconv.internal_encoding configuration options are unset, and for mbstring functions if the mbstring.http_input mbstring.http_output mbstring.internal_encoding configuration option is unset.\r\rAll versions of PHP will use this value as the charset within the default Content-Type header sent by PHP if the header isn't overridden by a call to header().\r\rSetting default_charset to an empty value is not recommended.

Name: mysql.allow_local_infile
Description: Allow accessing, from PHP's perspective, local files with LOAD DATA statements

Name: mysql.allow_persistent
Description: Whether to allow persistent connections to MySQL.

Name: mysql.max_persistent
Description: The maximum number of persistent connections. -1 means no limit.

Name: mysql.trace_mode
Description: Trace mode. When mysql.trace_mode is enabled, warnings for table/index scans, non free result sets, and SQL-Errors will be displayed. (Introduced in PHP 4.3.0)

Name: mysql.default_port
Description: The default TCP port number to use when connecting to the database server if no other port is specified. If no default is specified, the port will be obtained from the MYSQL_TCP_PORT environment variable, the mysql-tcp entry in /etc/services or the compile-time MYSQL_PORT constant, in that order. Win32 will only use the MYSQL_PORT constant.

Name: mysql.default_socket
Description: The default socket name to use when connecting to a local database server if no other socket name is specified.

Name: mysql.default_host
Description: The default server host to use when connecting to the database server if no other host is specified. Doesn't apply in SQL safe mode.

Name: mysql.default_user
Description: The default user name to use when connecting to the database server if no other name is specified. Doesn't apply in SQL safe mode.

Name: mysql.default_password
Description: The default password to use when connecting to the database server if no other password is specified. Doesn't apply in SQL safe mode.

Name: mysql.connect_timeout
Description: Connect timeout in seconds. On Linux this timeout is also used for waiting for the first answer from the server.
